title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 6192.4 - Accuracy and completeness of DNA records
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 6192.4 - Accuracy and completeness of DNA records

State Regulations

The accuracy and completeness of all DNA records maintained
as part of the DNA databank will be assured through compliance with laboratory
accreditation standards as promulgated by the commission in Part 6190 of this

Title. In addition, accuracy and completeness of all DNA records maintained as
part of the DNA databank will be assured through compliance by all forensic DNA
laboratories with the requirements of the
NDIS Operating

Procedures. Each DNA profile submitted must be certified by the
submitting laboratory as being associated with the appropriate controls and
blanks. Copies of all official correspondence between the DNA databank and
participating laboratories will be maintained in the appropriate division
file. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9

6192.4

Amended

New

York State Register June 7, 2017/Volume XXXIX, Issue 23, eff. 6/7/2017

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
